definition: the sun and moon like a shuttle (idiom); How time flies!
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
moon/month/monthly/CL:個|个[ge4],輪|轮[lun2]
as/as if/such as
shuttle (textiles)/to move back and fro

sentences.english: Swiftly fly the years, one season following another . Laden with happiness and tear .
sentences.chinese: 日月如梭，季節變換，滿載着歡樂和淚水。

sentences.english: Sun follows day. night, stars, and moon;
sentences.chinese: 日月如梭，星月滿天之後必然是黎明。

sentences.english: Time continues, times flies, and this world remains.
sentences.chinese: 時光流逝，光陰荏苒，日月如梭，世界依舊。

sentences.english: Time passes quickly, and now we are at the first anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，日月如梭，今天是他逝世後的第一個週年。
日月如梭，一切像是白馬過隙，結束得太快了。

sentences.english: Time is like an arrow, time elapse quickly, 50 years extraordinary years blends in historical endless flow.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，日月如梭，50年崢嶸歲月融入歷史長河。

sentences.english: But the years went by and then I was middle-aged and alone.
sentences.chinese: 日月如梭，轉眼我已人到中年，而且獨身一人。

sentences.english: The sun and the moon shuttle back and forth - how time flies.
sentences.chinese: 時間過得太快了，真是日月如梭啊。

definition: time flies (idiom)
time flies like an arrow (idiom); How time flies!
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
the passage of the years/the flow of time
in a flash (idiom)
(literary) (of time) to slip away
to pass in an instant/over in the twinkling of an eye
(of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
lit. the Big Dipper 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1] has turned and the stars have moved/time flies/also written 星移斗轉|星移斗转[xing1 yi2 Dou3 zhuan3]
in a flash/in the blink of an eye/to glance
time available
lit. the Big Dipper 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1] has turned and the stars have moved/time flies/also written 斗轉星移|斗转星移[Dou3 zhuan3 xing1 yi2]
a single day apart seems like three seasons (idiom)
pressing/urgent/poverty-stricken/destitute
eventful years/momentous times
